cat << 'ENDOFFILE' > train_and_predict.py
import pandas as pd
from sklearn.model_selection import train_test_split
from sklearn.preprocessing import StandardScaler
from sklearn.ensemble import RandomForestRegressor
from sklearn.metrics import r2_score
from sklearn.feature_selection import RFECV

# Load data
train = pd.read_csv('data/train.csv')
test = pd.read_csv('data/test.csv')

# Preprocess data
y_train = train['SalePrice']
X_train = train.drop(columns=['Id', 'SalePrice'])
X_test = test.drop(columns='Id')

# Fill missing values
X_train.fillna(X_train.mean(), inplace=True)
X_test.fillna(X_test.mean(), inplace=True)

# Encode categorical variables
X_train = pd.get_dummies(X_train)
X_test = pd.get_dummies(X_test)

# Initialize and fit RFECV
rfecv = RFECV(estimator=RandomForestRegressor(n_estimators=100), step=1, cv=5, scoring='r2')
rfecv.fit(X_train, y_train)

# Select important features
X_train_selected = X_train.iloc[:, rfecv.support_]
X_test_selected = X_test.iloc[:, rfecv.support_]

# Scale data
scaler = StandardScaler()
X_train_scaled = scaler.fit_transform(X_train_selected)
X_test_scaled = scaler.transform(X_test_selected)

# Train model
model = RandomForestRegressor(n_estimators=100, random_state=42)
model.fit(X_train_scaled, y_train)

# Predict and create submission
predictions = model.predict(X_test_scaled)
submission = pd.DataFrame({'Id': test['Id'], 'SalePrice': predictions})
submission.to_csv('submission.csv', index=False)

print("Submission created.")
ENDOFFILE

cat << 'ENDOFFILE' > train_and_predict.py
import pandas as pd
from sklearn.model_selection import train_test_split
from sklearn.preprocessing import StandardScaler
from sklearn.ensemble import RandomForestRegressor
from sklearn.metrics import r2_score
from sklearn.feature_selection import RFECV

# Load data
train = pd.read_csv('data/train.csv')
test = pd.read_csv('data/test.csv')

# Preprocess data
y_train = train['SalePrice']
X_train = train.drop(columns=['Id', 'SalePrice'])
X_test = test.drop(columns='Id')

# Fill missing values with appropriate methods
for col in X_train.columns:
    if X_train[col].dtype == 'object':
        X_train[col].fillna(X_train[col].mode()[0], inplace=True)
        X_test[col].fillna(X_test[col].mode()[0], inplace=True)
    else:
        X_train[col].fillna(X_train[col].mean(), inplace=True)
        X_test[col].fillna(X_test[col].mean(), inplace=True)

# Encode categorical variables
X_train = pd.get_dummies(X_train)
X_test = pd.get_dummies(X_test)

# Initialize and fit RFECV
rfecv = RFECV(estimator=RandomForestRegressor(n_estimators=100), step=1, cv=5, scoring='r2')
rfecv.fit(X_train, y_train)

# Select important features
X_train_selected = X_train.iloc[:, rfecv.support_]
X_test_selected = X_test.iloc[:, rfecv.support_]

# Scale data
scaler = StandardScaler()
X_train_scaled = scaler.fit_transform(X_train_selected)
X_test_scaled = scaler.transform(X_test_selected)

# Train model
model = RandomForestRegressor(n_estimators=100, random_state=42)
model.fit(X_train_scaled, y_train)

# Predict and create submission
predictions = model.predict(X_test_scaled)
submission = pd.DataFrame({'Id': test['Id'], 'SalePrice': predictions})
submission.to_csv('submission.csv', index=False)

print("Submission created.")
ENDOFFILE

cat << 'ENDOFFILE' > train_and_predict.py
import pandas as pd
from sklearn.model_selection import train_test_split
from sklearn.preprocessing import StandardScaler
from sklearn.ensemble import RandomForestRegressor
from sklearn.feature_selection import SelectFromModel
from sklearn.metrics import r2_score

# Load data
train = pd.read_csv('data/train.csv')
test = pd.read_csv('data/test.csv')

# Preprocess data
y_train = train['SalePrice']
X_train = train.drop(columns=['Id', 'SalePrice'])
X_test = test.drop(columns='Id')

# Fill missing values with appropriate methods
for col in X_train.columns:
    if X_train[col].dtype == 'object':
        X_train[col].fillna(X_train[col].mode()[0], inplace=True)
        X_test[col].fillna(X_test[col].mode()[0], inplace=True)
    else:
        X_train[col].fillna(X_train[col].mean(), inplace=True)
        X_test[col].fillna(X_test[col].mean(), inplace=True)

# Encode categorical variables
X_train = pd.get_dummies(X_train)
X_test = pd.get_dummies(X_test)

# Initialize and fit model
model = RandomForestRegressor(n_estimators=100, random_state=42)
model.fit(X_train, y_train)

# Feature importance based on the model
selector = SelectFromModel(model, prefit=True)
X_train_selected = selector.transform(X_train)
X_test_selected = selector.transform(X_test)

# Scale data
scaler = StandardScaler()
X_train_scaled = scaler.fit_transform(X_train_selected)
X_test_scaled = scaler.transform(X_test_selected)

# Train model again with selected features
model_selected = RandomForestRegressor(n_estimators=100, random_state=42)
model_selected.fit(X_train_scaled, y_train)

# Predict and create submission
predictions = model_selected.predict(X_test_scaled)
submission = pd.DataFrame({'Id': test['Id'], 'SalePrice': predictions})
submission.to_csv('submission.csv', index=False)

print("Submission created.")
ENDOFFILE

cat << 'ENDOFFILE' > train_and_predict.py
import pandas as pd
from sklearn.model_selection import train_test_split
from sklearn.preprocessing import StandardScaler
from sklearn.ensemble import RandomForestRegressor
from sklearn.feature_selection import SelectFromModel
from sklearn.metrics import r2_score

# Load data
train = pd.read_csv('data/train.csv')
test = pd.read_csv('data/test.csv')

# Preprocess data
y_train = train['SalePrice']
X_train = train.drop(columns=['Id', 'SalePrice'])
X_test = test.drop(columns='Id')

# Fill missing values with appropriate methods
for col in X_train.columns:
    if X_train[col].dtype == 'object':
        X_train[col].fillna(X_train[col].mode()[0], inplace=True)
        X_test[col].fillna(X_test[col].mode()[0], inplace=True)
    else:
        X_train[col].fillna(X_train[col].mean(), inplace=True)
        X_test[col].fillna(X_test[col].mean(), inplace=True)

# Encode categorical variables
X_train_encoded = pd.get_dummies(X_train)
X_test_encoded = pd.get_dummies(X_test)

# Ensure both sets of encoded data have the same features
X_test_encoded = X_test_encoded.reindex_like(X_train_encoded, fill_value=0)

# Initialize and fit model
model = RandomForestRegressor(n_estimators=100, random_state=42)
model.fit(X_train_encoded, y_train)

# Feature importance based on the model
selector = SelectFromModel(model, prefit=True)
X_train_selected = selector.transform(X_train_encoded)
X_test_selected = selector.transform(X_test_encoded)

# Scale data
scaler = StandardScaler(with_mean=False)
X_train_scaled = scaler.fit_transform(X_train_selected)
X_test_scaled = scaler.transform(X_test_selected)

# Train model again with selected features
model_selected = RandomForestRegressor(n_estimators=100, random_state=42)
model_selected.fit(X_train_scaled, y_train)

# Predict and create submission
predictions = model_selected.predict(X_test_scaled)
submission = pd.DataFrame({'Id': test['Id'], 'SalePrice': predictions})
submission.to_csv('submission.csv', index=F

import pandas as pd
from sklearn.model_selection import train_test_split
from sklearn.preprocessing import StandardScaler
from sklearn.ensemble import RandomForestRegressor
from sklearn.feature_selection import SelectFromModel
from sklearn.metrics import r2_score

# Load data
train = pd.read_csv('data/train.csv')
test = pd.read_csv('data/test.csv')

# Preprocess data
y_train = train['SalePrice']
X_train = train.drop(columns=['Id', 'SalePrice'])
X_test = test.drop(columns='Id')

# Fill missing values with appropriate methods
for col in X_train.columns:
    if X_train[col].dtype == 'object':
        X_train[col].fillna(X_train[col].mode()[0], inplace=True)
        X_test[col].fillna(X_test[col].mode()[0], inplace=True)
    else:
        X_train[col].fillna(X_train[col].mean(), inplace=True)
        X_test[col].fillna(X_test[col].mean(), inplace=True)

# Encode categorical variables
X_train_encoded = pd.get_dummies(X_train)
X_test_encoded = pd.get_dummies(X_test)

# Ensure both sets of encoded data have the same features
X_test_encoded = X_test_encoded.reindex(columns=X_train_encoded.columns, fill_value=0)

# Initialize and fit model
model = RandomForestRegressor(n_estimators=100, random_state=42)
model.fit(X_train_encoded, y_train)

# Feature importance based on the model
selector = SelectFromModel(model, prefit=True)
X_train_selected = selector.transform(X_train_encoded)
X_test_selected = selector.transform(X_test_encoded)

# Scale data
scaler = StandardScaler(with_mean=False)
X_train_scaled = scaler.fit_transform(X_train_selected)
X_test_scaled = scaler.transform(X_test_selected)

# Train model again with selected features
model_selected = RandomForestRegressor(n_estimators=100, random_state=42)
model_selected.fit(X_train_scaled, y_train)

# Predict and create submission
predictions = model_selected.predict(X_test_scaled)
submission = pd.DataFrame({'Id': test['Id'], 'SalePrice': predictions})
submission.to_csv('submission.cs
